summary: This is a memorandum documenting a voluntary interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) with a Federal Bureau of Prisons Discipline Hearing Officer, who was previously the Captain at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York when Jeffrey Epstein was housed there. The interview is part of the OIG's investigation into Epstein's death and includes attachments such as assignment rosters, count documentation, and facility maps from August 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the OIG investigation; a BOP inmate who died while housed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP Captain
events.description: Senior Special Agent and Special Agent from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary interview with a BOP Discipline Hearing Officer (former MCC Captain) regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: MCC New York Daily Operations
events.description: Reference to MCC New York Daily Assignment Rosters and inmate count documentation from August 9-10, 2019, the period around Epstein's death.

locations: Federal Correctional Institution (FCI) Fort Dix, New Jersey
Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York, New York
FCI Fort Dix West Side Administrative Building
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted an interview on June 15, 2021, as part of its investigation into the death of BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein.
The interviewee was a BOP Discipline Hearing Officer who served as the Captain at MCC New York when Epstein was housed there.
The memorandum references specific MCC New York operational documents from August 9-10, 2019, including daily assignment rosters and inmate count sheets.
The document states the interview was recorded and transcribed, with the recordings and transcript attached to the report.
The document is an internal OIG memorandum containing no recommendations or conclusions, and its distribution is restricted.
